content.description: The crux is a few moves below the top.
content.protection: Light rack up to two inches.  Bolts and chain anchor at the top.
content.location: The route is slightly uphill of Pop Goes the Climber.  Start in a small curving crack and climb straight up.  Rap the route.

content.description: The crux is a pull off the ground to establish oneself in the crack.
content.protection: Gear to about two inches (one 4 inch piece to protect the moves off the ground).  Two bolt anchors are on the large ledge.
content.location: The route is left of the shallow Open Book route in the center of the right side of the crag.

content.description: Chimney up the slot.
content.protection: TR off a gear anchor with some long slings.
content.location: The route is on the left side of a thin fin a bit downhill of For the Fun of It.

content.description: The crux is definitely the first moves on small holds off the ground.  Continue up the path of least resistance to the top.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a two bolt anchor at the top of the knob.
content.location: The route is a clean face just left of a left facing shallow dihedral on the upper right section of the cliff.

content.description: The crux is closer to the top on face holds.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a bolt and chain anchor.  Goes to the shared anchor with Start.  Rap the route.
content.location: The route is about in the middle of the upper right side of the crag.

content.description: The crux is a few moves off the ground going from a good jam to harder face climbing (the crux).  Continue up the fin to the top.
content.protection: TR off a shared anchor with Irrigation.
content.location: Start up the fin with a crack splitting the right side.

content.description: The route wanders, is punctuated with two ledges, but is probably the longest route at the crag.  Climb a slab (the crux) to a small ledge, hop over to a large blackish knob and go to the second ledge.  The climb then goes up a short face and crack to the top.
content.protection: 6 bolts to a shared anchor with Mahogany Blues.
content.location: Start low a few yards right of Knob Job on the center right side of a smooth slab.

content.description: Crack climbing with the crux at the wider corner section above.
content.protection: Light rack with several larger pieces (3 to 4 inches).  There are two bolts at the top.
content.location: The route is on the left of the upper right section.

content.description: One can climb either the face or a variation in the corner.
content.protection: TR off an anchor to the right of the Chicken Delight anchor.
content.location: The route is just right of Chicken Delight.

content.description: Lieback the start, the crux, and then continue face climbing up the right side of the fin.  Easier if the crack to the right is used.
content.protection: 3 bolts to the same anchor as Squeeze Play.
content.location: Climb at the black streak and up on the right side of the fin rock.

content.description: Climb the short crack (the crux) and continue up to a blunt arete to the left of a big knob.  Climb up the arete and then finish on easier face climbing to the right.
content.protection: TR to the shared anchor with Mahogany Blues.
content.location: The route is just left of the burrow approach to the lower level of the crag.  Start in the short hand crack.

content.description: Jam a short crack, the crux, and then bridge and face climb to the top.
content.protection: A light rack with cams up to 2 inches.  Shares an anchor with Mr. Finny.
content.location: The climb starts just right of Mr. Finny.  Rap the route.

content.description: Stem up a couple of parallel cracks, run up the easy middle section to the left of a flat face, and finish in a corner to top out.
content.protection: Light rack to a fist sized cam for the start.  Shares an anchor with The Finish.
content.location: Start about ten feet to the right of The Finish.  Rap the route.

content.description: Generally parallel For the Fun of It on the left.  The crux is an awkward right leg press (before the upper corner) up to obtain the slab where For the Fun of It finishes.
content.protection: TR, shares an anchor with For the Fun of It
content.location: Start in the weakness just a few feet left of For the Fun of It.

content.description: Climb the crack, rest on the big ledge and then continue straight up to the anchor on smaller holds
content.protection: TR from a two bolt anchor on the top of the knob.
content.location: The route starts in a curving crack just uphill from the Open Book route.

content.description: There are few harder moves off the ground, continue up the clean rock and come to a nose of rock.  Step right, undercling and then bear hug the two side of the nose and step straight up.  Finish up the flat face to the anchor.
content.protection: 6 bolts to a two bolt anchor
content.location: Burrow down rocks below Mahogany Rush to the next level below.  Start in the cleanest rock in the left center of the middle portion of the crag.

content.description: Go up a weakness on the left, cross a very easy slab to a shallow left facing dihedral and then up a final bulge to the top.  Fun climbing but the climb loses a star because of easy slab at the bottom.
content.protection: Light rack to hand sized cam.  Shares an anchor with Gumby.
content.location: This is last route on the left of the crag.  Rap the route

content.description: Start in the burrow right of Knob Job. You climb up the offwidthy area and pop out left to to the top of where the slab finishes. Then head up the crack on the left. (You can use one of the bolts from Meanderer at this point, but it might increase rope drag.) Then, on the ledge where you would normally go right for Meanderer and go left up the dihedral. Stay left in the crack and pop up and share the anchor with Knob Job.
content.protection: Trad. Doubles in everything from 0.3 to .75. Might be helpful to bring up a 3 or 4 for one section where you can place big pro, but it's not necessary.
content.location: The route is directly to the right of Knob Job and back in the burrow and then it just hugs the left crack the whole way up.

content.description: The climb is an easy crack pitch.
content.protection: Light rack with an emphasis on medium cams up to 3 inches.  Goes to the same anchor as Tally Ho.
content.location: The climb is simply a few feet uphill from Tally Ho.  Rap the route.

content.description: Jam and face climb off the deck (one crux), continue across a ledge and climb up a steep face (another crux) with a couple of smaller black knobs.  Finish up right on easy face climbing.
content.protection: TR to the shared anchor with Mahogany Blues.
content.location: Start a few feet to the right of For the Fun of It.

content.description: There are few crux moves off the ledge and then it is easy climbing and knobs to the top.
content.protection: 3 bolts or TR off two bolts (need long slings). It is better to set the anchor with a top belay as the bolts are very close to the edge.
content.location: Step up slightly left of the Mahogany Rush.

content.description: Stem and face climb up the fin rock on the left (path of least resistance).
content.protection: TR to the same anchor as Squeeze Play
content.location: Don't climb the chimney but start just right of the squeeze.

content.description: Beginner route up to the top of the northernmost column on the left side of the crag.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a bolt and chain anchor.  Rap the route.
content.location: Clip the bolts on the easy face just uphill of Lay Out.

content.description: This technical face/thin crack climb has a low crux but relatively sustained climbing to the top.
content.protection: Two bolts and gear for the lead.  Two bolts on top for a TR.
content.location: The route is just right of Mahogany Rush.

content.description: This is a small crag, on good rock, close to the city with a short walk. It is a good substitute for the climbing gym. There are several anchors on the right side which can be set for TRs by walking around the back from the right. It has an eastern aspect and is good for summer evenings. Keep an eye for rattle snakes in season.The upper right portion of the crag has two areas with several anchors each. Approach by going right and around to the left of the rock. The lower portion, containing several cracks, has a large ledge. Go around the upper knob, continue south, then east to the large flat ledge. The upper knob section requires a few fourth class moves straight up the west face to reach the top. There are also several anchors on the lower left section of the crag.An early guide to the area is published in Climbers Guide to the Lower Sandia Mountains by Barry & Rita Loucks (1989) pages 29-30. There are many TR variations of the principle lines.*** WATCH FOR RATTLESNAKES and if you find one leave it alone.The area has seen heavy use during covid.  Please TR off your own gear or rap to save the hardware.  There is no formal maintenance arrangement only kind volunteers.  Also have long slings for TR as the top flattens out especially on the downhill side.  Save your rope.  Lastly bring an adjustable wrench, multiple lead lowering pulls the draws on the protection bolts and the nuts loosen.
